Professional Experience  
Process Engineer  
Costain  
Costain House, Aviator Way, Manchester  
March  2020 - Present   
 
Costain Group Ltd are a technology company specialising in complex programme delivery and 
consultancy advisory services. As a natural resources process engineer , I am involved wit h projects 
across a variety of sectors, including: oil and gas, decarbonisation and wastewater.  My role has 
thus far comprised o f: 
 
• Assisting with the concept design of a hydrogen from waste production facility. During this 
project I produced process engin eering deliverables such as; basis of design, flow diagrams, 
equipment specification s, heat and mass balance  and a storag e/refuelling model.  
• Workin g on a FEED study to re -route offshore fluids to a different  onshore processing 
facility . On this project I produced P&ID’s, PFD’s, heat and mass balance , equipment 
specifications and Aspen HYSYS simulation.  I also remotely scribed HAZOP’s, HAZID’s and 
ENVID studies.  
• Working on a concept study to implement a compressor at a natural gas processing facility. 
During this project I produced Aspen HYSYS simulations, P&ID’s, heat and mass balances  
and equipment data sheets . 
• Working on a FEED stud y implement ing a vapour -liquid separator at one of the UK’s largest 
oil refineries. During this project I produced flow diagrams, heat and mass balances, line 
lists, data sheets and worked to appropriate standards to design the separator  vessel . I also 
participated in h azard studies such as risk assessments, HAZOPs and HAZIDs.  
• Updating department tools such as an excel VBA tool which calculates equipment time to 
failure in the event of a fire.  
• Liaising with technology vendors, clients and other external personnel to develop projects.  
• Developing a matrix to identify under -performing wastewater treatment works.  
• Updating P&ID’s , site standard operating procedures (SOPs)  and other site documentation  
for a range of wastewater treatment works.  
• Creating various design t emplates for use in both the clean water and wastewater sectors.  
 
Process / Project Engineer  
Argent Energy  - SWIRE Group  
Stanlow Refinery, Ellesmere Port, Cheshire  
July 2018 – February 2020   
 
Argent Energy is currently the largest biodiesel producer in the UK. Having joined the company as 
a graduate process project engineer, I quickly progressed into a managerial role in which I  led a 
small team responsible for capital expenditure (CapEx)  projects  across two UK sites . The  projects I 
was involved  with were  a mixture of process improvements, de -bottlenecks and environmentally  
driven projects , ranging  from concept studies through to installation. My role comprised of : 
 
• Managing a varie ty of end-to-end projects  up to £300k and leading p roject proposals  up to 
£800k .  
• Optimising cooling water flow rates to save £180k CapEx  by reducing cooling water 
 requirements by circa 50%.  
• Initiating a debottleneck project which was estimated  to increase annual profits by £120k 
upwards with only a 6 -month payback time.  
• Representing the Argent Energy Group in front of the Environmental Agency (EA) and the 
Scottish Environmental Protection Agency (SEPA) to present updates on environmentally 
driven projects.  
• Implementing a process safety culture through either contributing to or leading process 
hazard analyses . 
• Achieving 89% in the 1 -week IChemE Fundamentals of Process Safety training course.   
• Enhancing knowledge of design methodology and standards through the  1-week  IChemE 
Process Design Practices training course.  
• Producing project deliverables such as; project scopes, PFD’s, mass balances, P&ID’s, 
energy balances, control philosophies, cost -benefit analysis reports, equipment lists, 
optioneering reports and procurement lists.
